chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
b_nat: nat
Hb_nat: (2 <= b_nat)%nat
b: Z
Hb: 2 <= b
v: nat
m: nat
l: nat
Hv: Z.of_nat v = Z.sub (α (2 + m)) (α m)
Z2Zp_morph: ring_morphism 0 1 Z.add Z.mul Z.opp (Zp_zero Hv') (Zp_one Hv') (Zp_plus Hv') (Zp_mult Hv') (Zp_opp Hv') f
Am_iAm_mod: 〘 A m 〙 = ⊟ 〘 iA m 〙

Goal:
〘 A (2 * m) 〙 = ⊟ 〘 MZ_one 〙

Premises:
Decimal.opp = fun d : Decimal.int => match d with | Decimal.Pos d0 => Decimal.Neg d0 | Decimal.Neg d0 => Decimal.Pos d0 end : Decimal.int -> Decimal.int Arguments Decimal.opp _%dec_int_scope
Byte.of_nat = fun x : nat => match x with | 0%nat => Some Byte.x00 | 1%nat => Some Byte.x01 | 2%nat => Some Byte.x02 | 3%nat => Some Byte.x03 | 4%nat => Some Byte.x04 | 5%nat => Some Byte.x05 | 6%nat => Some Byte.x06 | 7%nat => Some Byte.x07 | 8%nat => Some Byte.x08 | 9%nat => Some Byte.x09 | 10%nat => Some Byte.x0a | 11%nat => Some Byte.x0b | 12%nat => Some Byte.x0c
Zp_zero : forall p : nat, p <> 0%nat -> Z_Zp p
Zp_opp : forall p : nat, p <> 0%nat -> Z_Zp p -> Z_Zp p
Notation Hv' := alpha_SSm_m_neq_0
N.mul = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos q => N.pos (p * q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments N.mul (_ _)%N_scope
Zp_plus : forall p : nat, p <> 0%nat -> Z_Zp p -> Z_Zp p -> Z_Zp p
A = fun n : nat => (α (2 + n), - α (1 + n), α (1 + n), - α n) : nat -> Z * Z * Z * Z Arguments A _%nat_scope
N.add = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => m | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => n | N.pos q => N.pos (p + q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments N.add (_ _)%N_scope
Zp_one : forall p : nat, p <> 0%nat -> Z_Zp p
Notation MZ_one := (ID_22 0 1)
N.sub = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos n' => match m with | 0%N => n | N.pos m' => match Pos.sub_mask n' m' with | Pos.IsPos p => N.pos p | _ => 0%N end end end : N -> N -> N Arguments N.sub (_ _)%N_scope
Zp_mult : forall p : nat, p <> 0%nat -> Z_Zp p -> Z_Zp p -> Z_Zp p
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : Z | Zpos : positive -> Z | Zneg : positive -> Z Arguments Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments Zneg _%positive_scope
ring_morphism : forall X : Type, X -> X -> (X -> X -> X) -> (X -> X -> X) -> (X -> X) -> forall Y : Type, Y -> Y -> (Y -> Y -> Y) -> (Y -> Y -> Y) -> (Y -> Y) -> (X -> Y) -> Prop
iA = fun n : nat => (- α n, α (1 + n), - α (1 + n), α (2 + n)) : nat -> Z * Z * Z * Z Arguments iA _%nat_scope
alpha_SSm_m_neq_0 = fun H : v = 0%nat => eq_ind_r (fun v : nat => Z.of_nat v = α (2 + m) - α m -> False) (fun Hv : Z.of_nat 0 = α (2 + m) - α m => (fun (H0 : α m < α (S m)) (H1 : α (S m) < α (S (S m))) => let heq_b : b = Z.of_nat b_nat := eq_refl : b = Z.of_nat b_nat in let Hb_nat0 : 2 <= Z.of_nat b_nat := ZifyClasses.rew_iff (2 <= b_nat)%nat (2 <= Z.of_nat b_nat) (ZifyClasses.mkrel nat Z le Z.of_nat Z.le Nat2Z.inj_le 2%nat 2 eq_refl b_nat (Z.of_nat b_nat) eq...

Zr_ring_lemma1 : forall (n : nat) (l : list Z) (lpe : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr Z * Ring_polynom.PExpr Z)) (pe1 pe2 : Ring_polynom.PExpr Z), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist 0 1 Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp eq (IDphi (R:=Z)) Z.of_N Z.pow l lpe ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval 0 1 Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp (IDphi (R:=Z)) Z.of_N Z.pow l pe1 = Ring_polynom.PEeval 0 1 Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp (IDphi (R:=Z)) Z.of_N Z.pow l pe2
MA_expo_A_binomial : forall m k l : nat, m = (l * k)%nat -> A m = ∑ (S l) (fun i : nat => MZ_scal (expoZ (l - i) (-1) * Z.of_nat (binomial l i) * expoZ i (α (S k)) * expoZ (l - i) (α k)) (MZ_expo i B))

Zring = {| Radd_0_l := fun x : Z => let hyp_list := nil in let fv_list := (x :: nil)%list in Zr_ring_lemma1 ring_subst_niter fv_list hyp_list (Ring_polynom.PEadd (Ring_polynom.PEc 0) (Ring_polynom.PEX Z 1)) (Ring_polynom.PEX Z 1) I (eq_refl <: (let lmp := Ring_polynom.mk_monpol_list 0 1 Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp Zeq_bool Z.quotrem hyp_list in Ring_polynom.Peq Zeq_bool (Ring_polynom.norm_subst 0 1 Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp Zeq_bool Z.quotrem ring_subst_niter lmp (Ring_polynom.PEadd (Ring_polynom.PEc 0) (Ring_polynom.PEX Z 1))) (Ring_polynom.norm...
Nat2Z.inj_sub : forall n m : nat, (m <= n)%nat -> Z.of_nat (n - m) = Z.of_nat n - Z.of_nat m
Nat2Z.inj_add : forall n m : nat, Z.of_nat (n + m) = Z.of_nat n + Z.of_nat m
Nat2Z.inj_mul : forall n m : nat, Z.of_nat (n * m) = Z.of_nat n * Z.of_nat m
Zp_is_ring : forall (p : nat) (Hp : p <> 0%nat), ring_theory (Zp_zero Hp) (Zp_one Hp) (Zp_plus Hp) (Zp_mult Hp) (fun x y : Z_Zp p => Zp_plus Hp x (Zp_opp Hp y)) (Zp_opp Hp) eq
A_is_sum : forall k : nat, A k = MZ_plus (MZ_scal (- α k) MZ_one) (MZ_scal (α (S k)) B)
Nat2Z.inj_sub_max : forall n m : nat, Z.of_nat (n - m) = Z.max 0 (Z.of_nat n - Z.of_nat m)
A_plus_mult : forall m n k l : nat, m = (n + l * k)%nat -> A m = MZ_mult (A n) (MZ_expo l (A k))
Rring_ring_lemma1 : forall (R : Type) (Rzero Rone : R) (Rplus Rmult Rminus : R -> R -> R) (Ropp : R -> R), ring_theory Rzero Rone Rplus Rmult Rminus Ropp eq ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval Rzero Rone Rplus Rmult Rminus Ropp (gen_phiZ Rzero Rone Rplus Rmult Ropp) id_phi_N (pow_N Rone Rmult) l pe1 = Ring_polynom.PEeval Rzero Rone Rplus Rmult Rminus Ropp (gen_phiZ Rzero Rone Rplus Rmult Ropp) id_phi_N (pow_N Rone Rmult) l pe2
A_minus : forall u v : nat, (v <= u)%nat -> A (u - v) = MZ_mult (A u) (iA v)
Z.mul_nonneg_nonneg : forall n m : Z, 0 <= n -> 0 <= m -> 0 <= n * m
mscal_Zplus : forall n : nat, mscal Z.add 0 n 1 = Z.of_nat n
Z2Zp_repr_canon : forall (p : nat) (Hp : p <> 0%nat) (u : Z), {v : Z | Z2Zp Hp u = Z2Zp Hp v /\ 0 <= v < Z.of_nat p}
Nat2Z.inj_le : forall n m : nat, (n <= m)%nat < -> Z.of_nat n <= Z.of_nat m
A_plus : forall u v : nat, A (u + v) = MZ_mult (A u) (A v)
bezout_rel_prime_lt : forall p q : nat, (0 < p < q)%nat -> is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | (a * p + b * q)%nat = (1 + p * q)%nat /\ (a <= q)%nat /\ (b <= p)%nat}}
Zp_repr_interval : forall (p : nat) (Hp : p <> 0%nat) (a b u : Z), Z.of_nat p <= b - a -> {v : Z | Z2Zp Hp u = Z2Zp Hp v /\ a <= v < b}
Z.max_spec : forall n m : Z, n < m /\ Z.max n m = m \/ m <= n /\ Z.max n m = n
plus_le_compat : forall n m p q : nat, (n <= m)%nat -> (p <= q)%nat -> (n + p <= m + q)%nat
A_mult : forall u v : nat, A (u * v) = MZ_expo u (A v)
